conclusion: Need to use the ideal gas law and the relationship between internal energy and temperature.
Understand the ideal gas law: pV = nRT.
Pressure at state A is p0, Volume at state A is V0, Temperature at state A is T0.
Using ideal gas law at state A: p0 V0 = nR T0.
Pressure at state C is 0.6p0, Volume at state C is 0.5V0.
Using ideal gas law at state C: 0.3 p0 V0 = nR T_C.
Relate temperatures using ideal gas law: 0.3 = T_C / T0.
The temperature at state C is 0.3 T0.
